intro: Jacea barbata, commonly known as the hairy jacea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, yellowish flowers. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Jacea barbata is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
